holidays.name: World Animal Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate animals and raise awareness about their rights and welfare worldwide.
holidays.origin: Established in 1931 at a convention of ecologists in Florence, Italy, it aims to promote better treatment of animals and recognition of their importance.
holidays.funFact: The date coincides with the feast day of St. Francis of Assisi, the patron saint of animals!

holidays.name: Taco Day (UK)
holidays.description: A fun celebration of tacos, encouraging everyone to enjoy this delicious Mexican dish with friends and family.
holidays.origin: Popularized by British food chains and social media, this day shines a spotlight on the tasty treat outside of its traditional homeland.
holidays.funFact: Although tacos are Mexican, the UK‚Äôs Taco Day is celebrated on October 4 instead of the US‚Äôs 'National Taco Day' on October 4 or 10 (varies)!

holidays.name: National Cinnamon Roll Day (Sweden)
holidays.description: Known as Kanelbullens Dag in Sweden, this sweet holiday celebrates the beloved cinnamon roll with coffee and cozy vibes.
holidays.origin: Started in 1999 by the Swedish Bakers' Association to boost the sales of cinnamon buns and enjoy fika, the cherished Swedish coffee break.
holidays.funFact: Swedes consume an estimated 10 million cinnamon buns on this day alone‚Äîenough to give everyone in Sweden about two each!

holidays.name: Name Your Car Day
holidays.description: A quirky day encouraging people to give their vehicles unique and amusing names, turning ordinary cars into beloved companions.
holidays.origin: Unofficial, created by car enthusiasts who wanted to personalize their rides and share humorous stories about their cars.
holidays.funFact: Naming cars often strengthens the bond between driver and vehicle ‚Äî some say it can even improve your car‚Äôs 'mood' on road trips!
